Description: SCI-FRI (Science Friction) is a project working towards inspiring young minds to pursue science and engineering as a career. Initiated by DARPA, this is a multi-year project working in conjunction with many different institutions and organizations, such as the Sesame Workshop and Carnegie Mellonâ€™s Human Computer Interaction Institute. The end-product will be a series of multi-platform games that apply adaptive, in-game analytics for Pre-K-3rd graders that inspires interest and teaches basic concepts in the field of science.
Languages: C#, HTML5, CSS, JavaScript, CreateJS Suite, Flash, Unity3D, 3DS Max
Categories: Large-scale analytics, learning assessments, adaptive learning technologies, optimum learning pathways

Software: TreeFrog Treasure, Refraction, Adaptive Refraction, Creature Capture, DragonBox Adaptive, Nanocrafter, Vampire Vision,
Description: The games create by the Center for Game Science at the University of Washington are highly adaptive games that also perform gameplay analytics across all game players.  Thus, the games continuously optimize and are massively scalable.
Categories: Large-scale analytics, learning assessments, adaptive learning technologies, optimum learning pathways

Software: Computer Science Student Network, Expediton Atlantis, Robot Virtual Worlds
Description: CS2N, or Computer Science Student Network, is a virtual center for computer science activities, robotics programming competitions, and computer science courses. CS2N provides step-by-step lessons to make programming easy for students by also providing access to virtual robots.
Languages: Unity, Maya, Ruby on Rails, Java, PHP, HTML5
Categories: Large-scale analytics, learning assessments, adaptive learning technologies, optimum learning pathways

Description: The goal of SpaceForce is gameplay that results in measureable metrics that demonstrate games provide an innovative approach to STEM learning and student emotional resilience.  SpaceForce runs in OurSpace, a portal built to host SpaceForce, its data and an HTML5 level editor.  Players can login & register with a unique ID to save game progress.  Plaza and Neurostorm focus on brain plasticity.  Specifically, Neurostorm trains players to focus their attention in a virtual environment, and Plaza helps to maintain the brain's agility.
Categories: Large-scale analytics, learning assessments, adaptive learning technologies, optimum learning pathways

Software: Go Vector Go, Team Vector, Deep Sea Dash
Description: CRESST games are designed to help young children (in grades K-3) learn advanced physics and promote scientific reasoning and socio-emotional skills.  The games promote improved understanding of the physics concepts force and motion, with emphasis on force magnitude & direction,  friction, mass, gravity, and slope.  These games also promote improved understanding of key social and emotional skills, such as anti-bullying and empathy.
